did.abstract: This group of ephemera, artifacts, and photographs was collected by John B. Manbeck, a former official Brooklyn Borough Historian (1993-2012). The collection consists of several buttons, coasters, a patch, and a class photograph.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of four buttons (Brooklyn Dodgers with mitt and bat hanging; Loeser's Dodgers; James Madison High School Class of June 1948; and Our Town Brooklyn with Bell Telephone logo, circa 1969), two coasters (Schaefer Beer, 1959; Ehret's Extra Beer, 1962), one patch (Jackie Robinson Day, Borough President Howard Golden, circa 1998), and one photograph of the PS 193 Class of 1945. The donor, John Manbeck, is the eigth student from the right in the top row.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: John B. Manbeck was born in 1931 and was educated at Bucknell University and New York University. His career included working for the American Broadcasting Company, as well as teaching English in New York City secondary schools and later teaching English and Journalism at Kingsborough Community College for 32 years. He served as the official Brooklyn Borough Historian from 1993 to 2002 and has written, edited, or contributed to a number of books relating to the history, people, and culture of Brooklyn. As of 2016, Manbeck lives in Brooklyn.
